weather_report:
The morning unfolds in Downtown San Francisco with a satisfying clarity, the sun casting its warm gaze upon the city, invigorating the spirit and promising a delightful day ahead. The high temperature will hover around fifty-nine degrees, sliding gently to about fifty-six by afternoon, accompanied by a whisper of a north-northwest breeze. This is no heavy wind; rather, it dances lightly at five to twelve miles per hour, ensuring that your morning coffee could be enjoyed outdoors without care for chill or discomfort. 

Tonight, the sky will drift into a state of tranquil clarity, holding steady under a blanket of stars with a low around forty-four. As you venture out to experience the evening, the breeze will soften, becoming a gentle caress at one to eight miles per hour. There is little sign of fog to be seen; the marine layer that often blankets the Bay has respectfully retreated, allowing the Golden Gate and the city's skyline to stand proud and uninterrupted. Given these pleasant conditions, attire should embrace layers—perhaps a light sweater or a stylish jacket, easily added or cast aside as the day shifts. A stroll through the city parks, an exploration of the waterfront, or even a quiet hour spent in one of the many intimate cafés would suit the day beautifully, as the serene backdrop invites simple joys and quiet contemplation.
